title: Subtle Serif / Left Slanted Serif
content:
I am loving these fonts but can't find them....any ideas?

THNX!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Left Slanted Serif.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140913005458/http:/typophile.com/files/Left%20Slanted%20Serif.jpg) | 7.66 KB |
| [Subtle Serif.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140913005458/http:/typophile.com/files/Subtle%20Serif.jpg) | 3.52 KB |
author: nmaria

comments.content:
subtle serif, could almost be  
\>\>\>Serif Gothic Roman  
but the R and S are different...

Subtle erif is close to [ITC Symbol](http://web.archive.org/web/20140913005458/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-symbol/) and [Alexon](http://web.archive.org/web/20140913005458/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/alexon-rr/) by Les Usherwood. There are a number of these tinyserif (MyFonts keyword) fonts. These two looked closest to me. They may have been manipulated graphically too.

- Mike Yanega
cool thnx, i had a feeling subtle serif was re-designed...best wishes Mike!

The left-slanted serif, seems to be a normal serif with the O and M graphically backslanted. I don't think that's the way the font was designed. I couldn't identify the serif offhand though. The longer baseline leg of the E should be a good clue.

- Mike Yanega
